page.title: 08Local History in Jedburgh
page.content: In the year 1566 Mary Queen Of Scots came to Jedburgh to preside over a Justice Ayres or Circuit Court .Her first stay was at the Spread Eagle Hotel.She left when a fire broke out. She found other accommodation in what is now known as Mary Queen Of Scots' House ,a bastel house built to repel invaders.While staying there she went a ride of 30 miles each way to Hermitage Castle to see Bothwell her lover.Mary fell ill on her return to Jedburgh.Before Mary was executed she was reported to have said,"Would I had died at Jedburgh".In 1817 a watch and horse_shoe which are thought to have been Mary's were found in a bog.The House was lived in for many years but is now a museum.
